root: ^Let's not waste time. Evelyn Blake didn't die by accident. This was a carefully planned crime, and one of you orchestrated it. By the end of this, I'll expose who.
^I'm here out of courtesy, Detective. I trust you'll wrap this up quickly.
^Same here. If you're going to waste our time, at least try to be interesting.
^I didn't do anything! Why am I even here? Evelyn was my everything. I could never hurt her!
^Everyone at this table had a motive. You all wanted something from Evelyn, but only two of you decided to take her life. Let's piece this together.

turnabout: ^Marina, the evidence is clear. You drugged Evelyn under the guise of helping her sleep. But ou weren't just there as a bystander. You were involved when she died.
^I didn't want this! It wasn't supposed to go this far! I just... I just wanted her to sign over the estate... but Victor--he--
^It was Victor...He said it would be fine. That we'd just scare her into signing it, but when she refused... he killed her. He killed her, and I stayed. I--I helped him clean up.
denial: ^She's lying! She was the one who wanted to push Evelyn, to force her into signing. I never wanted any of this! She helped clean up, she helped cover everything up.
^You were both there. You couldn't control her, so you killed her. Marina might have helped clean up, but the murder was yours wasn't it, Victor?
^I never meant for it to happen. She wouldn't listen, she wouldn't cooperate! You don't understand the pressure I was under. I had no choice! No choice!
timeline_choice: ^Now let me tell you all how the crime went.
timeline: ^ was with Evelyn on the night of her death, drugging them with sleeping pills.
^ when Evelyn was drunk and almost falling asleep, they ask for the documents to Evelyn's estate to be rewritten to their name.
^When Evelyn refuses, they take the troyphy and hits them, in order to scare her into listening, but that wasn't the case was it?
^The blow was too hard and she died immediately. The sudden death and her unfinished will made it so that Victor was next in line for the estate, therefore kept his company afloat.
arrest: ^, you're under arrest for the murder of Evelyn Blake.

b: ^, you're under arrest as an accomplice.

victor_branch: ^Shade: Evelyn changed her will, leaving her estate to you instead of charity. That alone is suspicious, but add your shredded documents, and it's clear you had something to hide.
^Evelyn's decision was her own. I simply helped her see the practicality of keeping her assets in the family. That's not a crime, is it?

^But it wasn't practicality, was it? It was desperation. Your finanical transactions show deals that were dependant on you gaining control of Evelyn's art. She refused to sell out, so you made sure she wouldn't have a choice.
^Detective, if you have proof of your accusations, I'd love to see it.
victor_push: ^Victor, the shredded documents in your office mentioned Marina and Evelyn's estate. You two planned this together, didn't you?
^Planning? No. Discussing logistics? Perhaps. Evelyn's art was the cornerstone of our efforts to save the company. That required coordination.
^Coordination to kill her? Marina provided the pills, you provided the motive, and together you silenced Evelyn when she refused to comply.
marina_branch: ^Marina, Evelyn's phone was found in your locked compartment. Care to explain why?
^She left it at my place during one of our meetings. I meant to return it, but then... well, you know what happened.
^Strange, considering Evelyn texted Lucas the night of her death. Are you saying she somehow managed that without her phone?
^Are you seriously suggesting I had something to do with her death? Victor and I were trying to protect her legacy, unlike some people.
marina_push: ^Marina, the receipts for wine and sleeping pills point directly to you. You drugged Evelyn to make her vulnerable. Care to deny it?
^You're twisting everything! I gave her pills because she couldn't sleep. The wine was for a celebration we'd planned. I didn't kill her!
^But you knew what Victor planned. You helped him set her up and clean the scene afterwards.
lucas_branch: ^Lucas, your alibi was shaky at best. Witnesses saw you near the studio after midnight.
^I didn't kill her! I went back because I was worried about her. I saw the light on and thought something was wrong, but when I got there, she was already--
^Dead? Or drugged and unconscious, waiting for Victor to finish the job?
^I don't know! I didn't stay long. I couldn't handle it!
lucas_push: ^Lucas, your reaction tells me you're hiding something. What aren't you saying?
^I loved her! But I knew something was wrong. Victor kept pushing her, and Marina was always in her ear. I should've done more to protect her!
^But you didn't. You were too afraid of what they'd do, weren't you?
